content.description:
“My claim against the U.S. is for three years services as [a] Nurse and cook in hospitals, and as commander of Several Men (Eight or Nine) as scouts [beginning in 1863] during the late war of the Rebellion, under directions and orders of Edwin M. Stanton, Secretary of War, and of several Generals.
“I claim for my services above named the sum of Eighteen hundred dollars.”
Harriet Tubman, formerly enslaved abolitionist activist, petition to the United States government for a pension, submitted in 1898
content.question: The development described in the excerpt best reflects which of the following?

choices.label: The establishment of free African American settlements in the West
The participation of African Americans in religious reform movements
The contribution of African American women to ending slavery
The advocacy of African Americans in support of voting rights

content.answer: The contribution of African American women to ending slavery

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify and describe a historical context for a specific historical development or process.
